title: ARISCAT Score for Postoperative Pulmonary Complications
description: Predicts risk of postoperative pulmonary complications including respiratory failure, respiratory infection, pleural effusion, atelectasis, pneumothorax, bronchospasm, or aspiration pneumonitis after surgery with general, neuraxial or regional anesthesia

parameters.name: respiratory_infection_last_month
parameters.description: Respiratory infection in the last month (upper or lower respiratory tract infection with fever and antibiotic treatment)

result.name: ariscat_score
result.description: ARISCAT score for postoperative pulmonary complications risk

ranges.description: Low risk of postoperative pulmonary complications
ranges.interpretation: Patients in this category have a low probability of developing postoperative pulmonary complications. Standard perioperative care and monitoring are usually sufficient.

ranges.description: Intermediate risk of postoperative pulmonary complications
ranges.interpretation: Patients in this category have an intermediate probability of developing postoperative pulmonary complications. Enhanced respiratory monitoring and preventive measures should be considered.

ranges.description: High risk of postoperative pulmonary complications
ranges.interpretation: Patients in this category have a high probability of developing postoperative pulmonary complications. Intensive respiratory monitoring, prophylactic measures, and possibly ICU care should be strongly considered.

references: Canet J, Gallart L, Gomar C, Paluzie G, Vallès J, Castillo J, et al. Prediction of postoperative pulmonary complications in a population-based surgical cohort. Anesthesiology. 2010;113(6):1338-50.
Mazo V, Sabaté S, Canet J, Gallart L, de Abreu MG, Belda J, et al. Prospective external validation of a predictive score for postoperative pulmonary complications. Anesthesiology. 2014;121(2):219-31.
formula: Sum of points: Age (≤50y: 0, 51-80y: 3, >80y: 16) + SpO2 (≥96%: 0, 91-95%: 8, ≤90%: 24) + Respiratory infection last month (No: 0, Yes: 17) + Anemia (No: 0, Yes: 11) + Surgical incision (Peripheral: 0, Upper abdominal: 15, Intrathoracic: 24) + Surgery duration (<2h: 0, 2-3h: 16, >3h: 23) + Emergency (No: 0, Yes: 8)
notes: ARISCAT was developed to predict postoperative pulmonary complications defined as respiratory failure, respiratory infection, pleural effusion, atelectasis, pneumothorax, bronchospasm, or aspiration pneumonitis
The score was validated in a large European cohort and has shown good predictive performance
Risk stratification helps guide perioperative management and resource allocation
